alert.note: Alert for Grand Forks (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 21 at 9:08PM CST until February 22 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST WEDNESDAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST TUESDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow. Additional snow accumulations of up to one inch. Winds gusting as high as 30 mph. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 45 below zero. * WHERE...In Minnesota, West Polk County. In North Dakota, Grand Forks County. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until noon CST Tuesday. For the Wind Chill Advisory, until noon CST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Areas of blowing snow will significantly reduce the visibility. The hazardous conditions will impact the Tuesday morning. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Use caution while outside. Wear appropriate winter clothing. The latest road conditions for North Dakota can be found at dot.nd.gov/travel and for Minnesota at 511mn.org, or by calling 5 1 1 in either state.
